definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent

sentences.english: These foods reduce the hotness and dryness.
sentences.chinese: 这些食物减少暑热和燥。

sentences.english: Hot weather, even the airport would have been intolerable heat.
sentences.chinese: 酷热的天气，连机场也会感到暑热难耐。

sentences.english: Summer substituting tea drinking also can remove the heat.
sentences.chinese: 夏天代茶饮还能清除暑热。

sentences.english: The pavement heaved and buckled in the heat .
sentences.chinese: 人行道在暑热中变得凹凸不平。

sentences.english: Consecutive rainy days reduce summer heat in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 连日阴雨，让北京夏天的暑热减去了几分。

sentences.english: Nanjing City has been called the "stove", Jinbing many northerners are very afraid of Shure .
sentences.chinese: 南京城素有“火炉”之称，金兵多是北方人甚怕暑热。

sentences.english: The girl fainted in the heat but she was soon brought round.
sentences.chinese: 这个姑娘在暑热中昏倒了，但很快就被救醒。

definition: the hottest period of the year/see 三伏天[san1 fu2 tian1]
three periods forming the hottest periods of summer, from mid-July to mid-August, namely: 初伏 (mid-July), 中伏 (late July to early August), 末伏 (mid-August)
to spend a summer holiday/(esp of Chinese medicine) to relieve summer heat
affected by heat/to suffer heatstroke or sunstroke
three periods forming the hottest periods of summer, from mid-July to mid-August, namely: 初伏 (mid-July), 中伏 (late July to early August), 末伏 (mid-August)
Dashu or Great Heat, 12th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 23rd July-6th August
